intro: Draba allenii, commonly known as Allen's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Draba allenii has a low, mat-forming growth habit with basal leaves and is often found in mountainous regions. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch of white or pale yellow to its habitat.
